metadata.feature_description: Create new wiki articles with title, content, and metadata, supporting both draft and published states

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki module and click Create article
steps.actual: Create article dialog opened with form fields

steps.action: Fill in title, select article type, add content and tag, UNCHECK Approved checkbox
steps.expected: Form accepts input with Approved unchecked
steps.actual: Form filled successfully with Approved checkbox unchecked
Article created successfully, shows 'awaiting moderation' message indicating draft state

steps.action: Click Create article, fill form with Approved checkbox CHECKED
steps.expected: Form accepts input with Approved checked
steps.actual: Form filled with title, type, content, tag, and Approved checkbox checked
Article published successfully, no 'awaiting moderation' message - published immediately

steps.action: View the primary article section at top of Wiki page
steps.expected: Primary article displayed with Edit button
steps.actual: Primary article shown with Edit button visible

steps.expected: Simplified edit dialog opens (only Content field, no Title/Type/Tags)
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened showing only Content editor - Title, Article Type, and Tags fields are hidden for primary article as expected

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Validate required fields (title, content, type, tags)

steps.action: Open Create article dialog and click Publish without filling any fields
steps.expected: Validation errors shown for required fields
steps.actual: Validation errors displayed for Title, Article Type, Content, and Tags - all showing 'Text is required' error messages

steps.action: Fill form with title of existing article 'Published Test Article - Jan 16 2026', same Article Type (Misc.), add content and tag
steps.actual: Form filled with duplicate title, ready to submit

steps.expected: Error message indicating article already exists
steps.actual: Error dialog displayed: 'Unable to publish the changes to your article: An error has occurred.' Server returned 406 (Not Acceptable). Article creation was blocked.

issues: Error message is generic rather than specific 'Article already exists' message. The duplicate is prevented but user feedback could be more informative.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create article with special characters in title

steps.action: Fill form with special characters in title: Test Special Chars: <>&"'@#$! - Jan 16 2026
steps.actual: Form accepted special characters in title field

steps.expected: Article created with special characters properly encoded
steps.actual: Article created successfully. URL encoded special characters (lt-gt-amp in URL), title displays correctly with special characters rendered

steps.action: Attempt to enter title longer than 100 characters (the configured maxlength)
steps.expected: Title field should enforce maximum length limit
steps.actual: HTML maxlength attribute enforced - input limited to exactly 100 characters. Attempted to enter 143 characters but field truncated to 100.

observations: Profanity filter functionality exists in code (ContentController.cs lines 746-768) with two modes: FilterContent (replaces profanity) and ProhibitContent (blocks submission). Testing requires knowledge of configured profanity word list and module settings, which are admin-configurable. Cannot fully test via UI without access to admin profanity configuration.
The 'Approved' checkbox on the article creation form controls whether the article is published immediately (checked) or saved as draft awaiting moderation (unchecked).
Primary article editing shows a simplified form with only the Content field - Title, Article Type, TOC, and Tags fields are hidden since these are fixed for the primary article.
Article titles with special characters are properly URL-encoded (e.g., < becomes lt, > becomes gt, & becomes amp) while displaying correctly in the UI.
Duplicate title detection is based on the combination of module, title, article type, and group - same title with different article type may be allowed.
